episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the unique construction materials of the Taj Mahal, the challenges of playing golf on an ever-changing ice course in Greenland, the historical prohibition of stripes in 14th-century France, and the Victorian obsession with ferns that nearly led to the extinction of some species.

facts.fact: The dome of the Taj Mahal is held together with sugar, fruit juice, and egg white.
There is an ice golf championship held each year in Greenland, 600 kilometers north of the Arctic Circle, but no players hold any records on that course because it changes on a daily basis.
In the 14th century, you could be executed in France for wearing stripes because they were the clothing of the devil.
Victorian Britain had such a fern mania for so many years that some species were almost completely wiped out.
